intro: Raphanus sativus subsp. oleifer, commonly known as the oil radish, is a biennial plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy roots that store a high amount of oil. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with pinnately lobed leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sunlight for optimal growth.
